verses.name: Proverbs 16:22
verses.text: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:23
verses.text: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:24
verses.text: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:25
verses.text: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:26
verses.text: He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.

verses.name: Proverbs 16:27
verses.text: An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.
